creditline: Gift of Carol and Jeffrey Horvitz
inscription: on label: 作品名　灰赫陶「輪波」  (Title: Haikakutō Rinpa); 氏名　加古勝巳 (Artist name: Kako Katsumi); 住所　篠山市上筱見381 (Address: Sasayamashi Kamisasami 381)
markings: paper tag taped to bottom with Japanese writing in black ink
text: Kako Katsumi was born into a family of Kyoto potters who mainly created mass-produced painted porcelain bowls and plates. Kako freed himself from that repetitive work and created his own style. He typically uses red ash glaze, which he sometimes applies in a symmetrical pattern, as in this case.
title: Red-ash vessel Wave Circle
